page.title: 15THEATRE AND CINEMA
page.content: In 1980 the Pavilion (now the Jolly Roger Theatre), with its ornate balcony was built at the Peir head.An early visitor here was Edgar Wallace the famous novelist,who was then earning 15s. a week as a builders labourer in the town.In 1884 was opened the Operetta House (now the Savoy Theatre) which was part of the new Town Hall buildings.No record of local entertainment would be complete without a tribute to Bert Graham and Will Bentley who for forty years produced their popular concerts.Among famous artistes associated with Clacton in their younger years were Norman McKinnel, the actor manager; Lionel Tertis, the violist; and Stanley Holloway, the comedian.
